conclusion: Determine contributions from each charge and sum them vectorially.
Square has side length L, diagonals intersect at center O, distance from vertex to center is L√2/2.
Electric field E due to point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Each charge at vertices contributes to electric field at center.
Charges at A and C are +q and -q; charges at B and D are +q and -q.
Electric field due to +q at A points away from A; due to +q at B points away from B; due to -q at C points towards C; due to -q at D points towards D.
Horizontal components of fields from A and C cancel; horizontal components from B and D cancel; vertical components from A and B add up, and from C and D add up.
Net electric field due to A and B at center is E_AB = 2(kq/(L√2/2)^2) cos(45°).
Net electric field due to C and D at center is E_CD = 2(kq/(L√2/2)^2) cos(45°).
Total electric field at center is E_total = E_AB + E_CD = 8kq/(L^2√2).
Electric field strength at intersection of diagonals is E = 8kq/(L^2√2).
